intro: Zaluzianskya pilosa, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to dry, coastal climates. Zaluzianskya pilosa is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
